channel.title: Javalobby Front Page
channel.description: Top Java developer news and issue discussions from Javalobby.org.

item.title: JEXE: A new(ish) way to launch Java apps from the desktop
item.description: We've all heard the arguments before about JVM size and deployment, but Simon has taken the time to write up a new proposal for how we can make it easier to only grab the pieces of the JVM we want.
item.author: Matthew Schmidt

item.title: Java EE Fallacies: EJBs are too complex, POJOs are easier.
item.description: Invent vs. use infrastructure. It sems like many developers think Java EE is complex, and reinventing the wheel is easier.
item.author: adam bien

item.title: Sun Planning new Dynamic Language Support for JVM
item.description: Sun is planning on making it easier to build dynamic languages ontop of the JVM by planning new bytecode instructions for future versions of Java.
item.author: Michael Urban

item.title: Interested in XML SWT Factory ?
item.description: We are currently working on an XML SWT Factory, and the concept seems to have proved itself. Would anyone be interested in using it under the Apace License 2.0?
item.author: Jakob Jenkov

item.title: Is Java faster on Vista?
item.description: Rick & Matt notice an appreciable speedup in web application performance after installing Mustang on Vista. Is it possible that Java is faster on Vista?
item.author: Rick Ross

item.title: Pluggable annotations
item.description: Feature number 7, pluggable annotations. Is it a nice recipe for a nightmare? And they are proud of it?
item.author: Serge Bureau

item.title: Trolltech releases technology preview of Java Qt
item.description: Qt has been quoted to be better than Java at cross platform GUI building with native UIs on all major and not so major platforms. Try out the Qt Jambi for the best of breed and tell us what you think!
item.author: Thomas Zander

item.title: On being more productive
item.description: I wish that, during the development, I could eliminate the write-compile-test cycle. Right now I think that it is not possible but what should happen to make this goal a reality?
item.author: James

item.title: MVM - Not in Mustang - Then When?
item.description: Java needs MVM for Swing to survive. Desktop GUI apps. are not possible without a good MVM implementation. What are we supposed to tell small business clients: can't run the three Swing apps together?
item.author: Vinay Soni

item.title: Where I stand in the current job market
item.description: So, I just graduated this May with a BS in Computer Science. I know Java very well. I also know SQL. And I still can't get a job.
item.author: Jigar Suthar
